titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Frank Story, Indictment
CWG5757

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Gallatin Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against } Indictment for Felony
Frank Story Deft

The Grand Jury of Gallatin County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse, Frank Story of the offense of unlawfully taking and detaining a white woman against her will with intent to have carnal knowledge with her himself committed as follows viz

The said Frank Story in the county circuit and state aforesaid on the Day of July 1863 did unlawfully take and detain medora Jane Kelly a white woman, against her will with intent to have carnal knowledge with her himself Contrary to the Statute in Such case made and provided and against the peace and Dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

John L Scott
Comth atto for 8th J D

Gallatin Cir Ct
The Commonwealth against Frank Story
A Copy
remitted
6th Aug/64
